tit.e: Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Takehito
tit.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 有栖川宮 威仁親王（ありすがわのみや たけひとしんのう、文久2年1月13日（1862年2月11日） - 大正2年（1913年）7月5日）は、日本の皇族、軍人。
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takehito (February 11th, 1862 - July 5th, 1913), Japanese Imperial family, soldier.
Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takehito (February 11th, 1862 - July 5th, 1913), Japanese Imperial family, soldier.
Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Takehito (February 11, 1862 - July 5, 1913), Japanese Imperial family, soldier.
sen.cmt: 日付表記Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 官職は軍事参議官。
sen.e: A government official position was military affairs government adviser.
His official government position was military affairs government adviser.
His official government position was military affairs government adviser.

sen.j: 勲等は大勲位功三級、称号・階級は元帥海軍大将。
sen.e: His order of merit was the third kyu of the Grand Order of the Chrysanthemum, the title, rank was Marshal and Admiral.
sen.cmt: 大勲位功三級→[定訳不明]
sen.e: His order of merit was the third kyu of the Grand Order of the Chrysanthemum, the title and rank was Marshal and Admiral.
His order of merit was the third kyu of the Grand Order of the Chrysanthemum, the title and rank was Marshal and Admiral.

sen.j: 有栖川宮幟仁親王の第四王子（男女合わせた王子女の中では八人目、但し成人した男子は熾仁親王と威仁親王だけ）で、生母は家女房の森則子。
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Takehito's fourth Prince, (the eighth child including Princesses, but there were only Imperial Prince Taruhito and Takehito, who turned over twenty years old) the birth mother was a court lady, 森則子.
sen.cmt: 森則子→読み方確認できず
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince, Takehito's fourth Prince, (the eighth child including Princesses, but only Imperial Prince Taruhito and Takehito, lived past the age of twenty) the birth mother was a court lady, 森則子.

Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince, Takehito's fourth Prince, (the eighth child including Princesses, but only Imperial Prince Taruhito and Takehito, lived past the age of twenty) the birth mother was a court lady, Noriko Mori.
sen.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせるスペース削除森則子→Noriko Mori［正しい読み方が不明です］

sen.j: 有栖川宮熾仁親王は異母兄。
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Taruhito was half older brother.
Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Taruhito was a half older brother.
Arisugawa no Miya Imperial Prince Taruhito was a half older brother.
sen.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 幼称は稠宮（さわのみや）。
sen.e: His name from childhood was Sawanomiya.
His name from childhood was Sawanomiya.
His name from childhood was Sawanomiya.

sen.j: 妃は加賀国加賀藩主前田慶寧の娘・威仁親王妃慰子（やすこ）。
sen.e: The Empress was the Lord of the Kaga domain in Kaga Province, Yoshiyasu MAEDA's daughter, Imperial Prince Takehito's Empress Yasuko.
The Empress was the Lord of the Kaga domain in Kaga Province, Yoshiyasu MAEDA's daughter, Imperial Prince Takehito's Empress Yasuko.
The Empress was the Lord of the Kaga Domain in Kaga Province, Yoshiyasu MAEDA's daughter, Imperial Prince Takehito's Empress Yasuko.

sen.j: 文久2年1月13日（1862年2月11日）、京都において誕生、稠宮と命名された。
sen.e: He was born on February 11th, 1862 in Kyoto and named 稠宮.
sen.cmt: 稠宮→読み方確認できず
sen.e: He was born on February 11th, 1862 in Kyoto and named 稠宮.
He was born on February 11, 1862 in Kyoto and named Sawanomiya.

sen.j: 有栖川宮家にはすでに熾仁親王という嫡子がいたため、稠宮は親王家の慣例に従い、然るべき年齢に達した後に妙法院の門跡となることが内定した。
sen.e: Since there was Imperial Prince Taruhito in Arisugawanomiya family as the oldest son, 稠宮 was decided unofficially to enter into Myoho-in Temple and become a priest-prince when he reached the appropriate age, following the custom of the Imperial family.

Since Imperial Prince Taruhito was the oldest son in Arisugawanomiya family, 稠宮 was decided unofficially to enter into the Myoho-in Temple and become a priest-prince when he reached the appropriate age, following the custom of the Imperial family.

Since Imperial Prince Taruhito was the oldest son in Arisugawa no Miya family, Sawanomiya was decided unofficially to enter into the Myoho-in Temple and become a priest-prince when he reached the appropriate age, following the custom of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる稠宮→Sawanomiyaスペース削除

sen.j: しかし、明治維新による諸制度の変革で宮門跡の制度が廃されたことから、明治4年（1871年）に稠宮の妙法院門跡内定は解約され、明治天皇によって父幟仁親王が東京への転居を命じられたのに従い、稠宮も上京した。
sen.e: However, due to the change of various regulations after the Meiji Restoration, the custom for the Imperial family to become a priest-prince in a certain occasions was abolished, the pre-arrangement for 稠宮 to enter into the temple to become a priest prince was cancelled in 1871, when Emperor Meiji ordered Imperial Prince Takehito to move to Tokyo, 稠宮 also moved to Tokyo.

However, due to the change of various regulations after the Meiji Restoration, this custom was abolished, the pre-arrangement for 稠宮 to enter into the temple to become a priest prince was cancelled in 1871, when Emperor Meiji ordered Imperial Prince Takehito to move to Tokyo, 稠宮 also moved to Tokyo.

However, due to the change of various regulations after the Meiji Restoration, this custom was abolished, the pre-arrangement for Sawanomiya to enter into the temple to become a priest prince was cancelled in 1871, when Emperor Meiji ordered Imperial Prince Takehito, his father, to move to Tokyo, Sawanomiya also moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）7月8日、参内した稠宮は明治天皇から海軍軍人を志すよう命じられ、同月13日、海軍兵学寮予科に入学した。
sen.e: On July 8th 1874, 稠宮 was recommended by the Emperor Meiji to become a sailor when he visited the Imperial Palace, he entered into the preparatory course for Naval Academy on July 13th.
sen.cmt: 海軍兵学寮予科→the preparatory course for Naval Academy[定訳不明]
sen.e: On July 8th 1874, 稠宮 was recommended by Emperor Meiji to become a sailor when he visited the Imperial Palace, he entered into the preparatory course for the Naval Academy on July 13th.
On July 8, 1874, Sawanomiya was recommended by Emperor Meiji to become a sailor when he visited the Imperial Palace, he entered into the preparatory course for the Naval Academy on July 13.
sen.cmt: 日付表記稠宮→Sawanomiyaスペース削除

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）、前田慰子と婚約。
sen.e: He engaged with Yasuko MAEDA in 1876.
sen.cmt: 前田慰子→読み方確認できず
sen.e: He was engaged to Yasuko MAEDA in 1876.
He was engaged to Yasuko MAEDA in 1876.

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）、西南戦争の征討総督として九州赴任中の熾仁親王からの呼び出しにより、稠宮は船で鹿児島に赴き、熾仁親王と共に戦地跡を視察した。
sen.e: In 1877 when Imperial Prince Taruhito, the Governor-General of Suppression of the Seinan War called 稠宮, he went to Kagoshima by ship and inspected place where the War was, together with the Prince.
sen.cmt: 征討総督→the governor-general of suppression[定訳不明]
sen.e: In 1877 Imperial Prince Taruhito, the Governor-General for the Suppression of the Seinan War called 稠宮, went to Kagoshima by ship and inspected the place where the War was taking place, together with the Prince.

In 1877 Imperial Prince Taruhito, the Governor-General for the Suppression of the Seinan War called Sawanomiya, went to Kagoshima by ship and inspected the place where the War was taking place, together with the Prince.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）4月、40歳を過ぎて妃との間に継嗣の出来ない熾仁親王は、稠宮を事実上の養子として有栖川宮家の後継者にしたい旨を明治天皇に願い出る。
sen.e: In April 1878, since there was no children between Imperial Prince Taruhito and the Empress, when he was over forty years old, he asked Emperor Meiji to adopt 稠宮 as an actual successor to the Arisunogawanomiya family.

In April 1878, since there were no children between Imperial Prince Taruhito and the Empress, when he was over forty years old, he asked Emperor Meiji to adopt 稠宮 as an actual successor to the Arisunogawanomiya family.

In April 1878, since there were no children between Imperial Prince Taruhito and the Empress, when he was over forty years old, he asked Emperor Meiji to adopt Sawanomiya as an actual successor to the Arisugawa no Miya family.

sen.j: 当時はまだ旧皇室典範制定前で、皇族の継承権問題が天皇の裁量で決められたため、5月18日に勅許が出された。
sen.e: It was before the Imperial Family Law was introduced at that time, since the Emperor had a power to decide who to succeed to the throne, the Imperial order was issued from the Emperor on May 18th.
It was before the Imperial Family Law was introduced at that time, since the Emperor had power to decide who would succeed to the throne, the Imperial order was issued from the Emperor on May 18th.
It was before the Imperial Family Law was introduced at that time, since the Emperor had power to decide who would succeed to the throne, the Imperial order was issued from the Emperor on May 18.

sen.j: これにより同年8月26日、稠宮は明治天皇の養子となり、親王宣下を受けて威仁の名を下賜された。
sen.e: Due to this, 稠宮 became an adopted child to Emperor Meiji, and he was given the name of Takehito after receiving an order by Imperial Order to become a Prince on August 26th.
sen.cmt: 親王宣下→to title Prince by Imperial Order[定訳不明]
sen.e: Because of this, 稠宮 became an adopted child of Emperor Meiji, and he was given the name Takehito after receiving an order by Imperial Order to become a Prince on August 26th.
Because of this, Sawanomiya became an adopted child of Emperor Meiji, and he was given the name Takehito after receiving an order by Imperial Order to become a Prince on August 26.

sen.j: この日、威仁親王は兄熾仁親王と親子盃の儀式を取り交わした。
sen.e: On this day Imperial Prince Takehito and his older brother Taruhito had a ceremony to take a pledge of becoming father and son.
On this da, Imperial Prince Takehito and his older brother Taruhito held a ceremony to take a pledge to become father and son.
On this day, Imperial Prince Takehito and his older brother Taruhito held a ceremony to take a pledge to become father and son.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）、威仁親王は太政官より、イギリス海軍シナ海艦隊旗艦・「アイアン・デューク（Iron Duke）」への乗組みを命ぜられ、約1年間、通常の若手士官と同じように過酷な艦上作業に従事した。
sen.e: In 1879 Imperial PrinceTakehito was ordered by the General Council of State to go on board on the British Navy China sea fleet flagship, 'Iron Duke', he worked under hard condition same as other young navy officers on the warship for a year.

In 1879 Imperial PrinceTakehito was ordered by the General Council of State to go aboard the British Navy China sea fleet flagship, 'Iron Duke', he worked under hard conditions the same as other young navy officers, on the warship, for a whole year.

In 1879 Imperial Prince Takehito was ordered by the General Council of State to go aboard the British Navy China sea fleet flagship, 'Iron Duke,' he worked under hard conditions the same as other young navy officers, on the warship, for a whole year.
sen.cmt: コンマの位置スペース挿入

sen.j: 帰国後の明治13年（1880年）、少尉に任ぜられたのを皮切りに帝国海軍士官としての歩みを始める。
sen.e: After he went back to Japan in 1880, he was appointed as Rear Admiral to start with, then he started his new life as an empire navy officer.
After returning to Japan in 1880, he was appointed as Rear Admiral to start with, and he started his new life as an Imperial navy officer.
After returning to Japan in 1880, he was appointed as Rear Admiral to start with, and he started his new life as an Imperial navy officer.

sen.j: この年の12月1日、前田慰子と結婚。
sen.e: He married to Yasuko MAEDA on December 1st, 1880.
He married Yasuko MAEDA on December 1st, 1880.
He married Yasuko MAEDA on December 1, 1880.

sen.j: 新婚間もない明治13年（1880年）1月、威仁親王は慰子を残してイギリスのグリニッジ海軍大学校に留学、3年半後の明治16年（1883年）6月にようやく帰国した。
sen.e: In January 1880, just after he married, he left Yasuko behind and went to the Old Royal Naval College in England for study, three years later he finally came back in June 1883.
In January 1880, just after he married, he left Yasuko behind and went to the Old Royal Naval College in England for study, three years later he finally returned in June 1883.
In January 1880, just after he married, he left Yasuko behind and went to the Old Royal Naval College in England for study, three and a half years later he finally returned in June 1883.

sen.j: 海軍大佐として巡洋艦「高雄」艦長在任中の明治24年（1891年）、威仁親王はロシア帝国のニコライ皇太子（後のニコライ2世）来日の際、外国留学の経験を買われ明治天皇の名代として接待役を命じられた。
sen.e: While the Prince was working as a Captain of cruiser 'Takao' in 1891, he was ordered to accompany Prince NicholasⅡ(Later called NicholasⅡ) (Nikolay Aleksandrovich) who came to visit Japan, as he was taken his credit that he had some experience to study in overseas.

While the Prince was a Captain of the cruiser 'Takao' in 1891, he was ordered to accompany Prince NicholasⅡ(Later called NicholasⅡ) (Nikolay Aleksandrovich) who came to visit Japan, as he was credited for some his experience studying overseas.

While the Prince was a Captain of the cruiser 'Takao' in 1891, he was ordered to accompany Prince NicholasⅡ(Later called NicholasⅡ) (Nikolay Aleksandrovich) of Russian Empire who came to visit Japan, as he was credited for some his experience studying overseas.

sen.j: このニコライ皇太子訪日の日程中、滋賀県大津市においていわゆる大津事件が発生、外国皇族に日本の官憲が危害を加えるという日本外交史始まって以来の大事件となる。
sen.e: During the Prince Nicholas's stay in Japan, the Otsu Incident happened in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, this was the first majour incident in the Japanese history when Japanese authorities harmed Imperial family from overseas.

During Prince Nicholas's stay in Japan, the Otsu Incident occurred in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, this was the first major incident in Japanese history of Japanese authorities harming the Imperial family from overseas.

During Prince Nicholas's stay in Japan, the Otsu Incident occurred in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, this was the first major incident in Japanese history of Japanese authorities harming the Imperial family from overseas.

sen.j: しかし、威仁親王の要請により明治天皇じきじきにニコライの見舞いが行われる等、日本側が誠実な対応をしたことによりロシアとの関係が決定的に悪化する事はなかった。
sen.e: However the relationship between Japan and Russia did not go worse since the issue was dealt with sincerity, Imperial Prince Takehito asked Emperor Meiji himself to go and see Prince Nicholas and so on.
However the relationship between Japan and Russia did not suffer since the issue was dealt with sincerely, Imperial Prince Takehito asked Emperor Meiji himself, to go and see Prince Nicholas, etc.
However the relationship between Japan and Russia did not suffer since the issue was dealt with sincerely, Imperial Prince Takehito asked Emperor Meiji himself, to go and see Prince Nicholas, etc.

sen.j: 明治28年（1895年）、兄・熾仁親王の薨去に伴い、威仁親王は有栖川宮家の第10代の当主となった。
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Imperial Prince Taruhito died in 1895, the Prince became the tenth successor of the Arisunogawanomiya family.
After Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Imperial Prince Taruhito died in 1895, the Prince became the tenth successor of the Arisunogawanomiya family.
After Imperial Prince Takehito's older brother, Imperial Prince Taruhito died in 1895, the Prince became the tenth successor of the Arisugawa no Miya family.
sen.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: 熾仁親王同様明治天皇の信任が篤く、皇太子（後の大正天皇）の教育係である東宮輔導に任命されている。
sen.e: He had a complete trust of Emperor Meiji, just like Imperial Prince Taruhito, he was appointed as an educator of the Crown Prince.
He had a complete trust of Emperor Meiji, just like Imperial Prince Taruhito, and was appointed as an educator of the Crown Prince.
He had a complete trust of Emperor Meiji, just like Imperial Prince Taruhito, and was appointed as an educator of the Crown Prince (later Emperor Taisho).

sen.j: 威仁親王は慰子妃との間に績子（いさこ）女王、栽仁王、徳川實枝子の3人の王子女を儲けた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Takehito had three Princesses and Princes with Masako, those were Princess Isako, Prince Tanehito and Mieko TOKUGAWA.
Imperial Prince Takehito had three Princesses and Princes with Masako, they were; Princess Isako, Prince Tanehito, and Mieko TOKUGAWA.
Imperial Prince Takehito had three Princesses and Princes with Masako, they were; Princess Isako, Prince Tanehito, and Mieko TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 績子女王は生後間もなく薨去。
sen.e: Princess Isako dies soon after she was born.
Princess Isako died soon after she was born.
Princess Isako died soon after she was born.

sen.j: 栽仁王は海軍兵学校在学中の明治41年（1908年）、虫垂炎によって20歳の若さで妻子のないまま薨去した。
sen.e: In 1908 Prince Tanehito died young of appendicitis when he was twenty years old, while he was studying at naval academy and had no wife and children.
In 1908 Prince Tanehito died young of appendicitis when he was twenty years old, while studying at the naval academy and had no wife and children.
In 1908 Prince Tanehito died young of appendicitis when he was twenty years old, while studying at the naval academy and had no wife and children.

sen.j: 實枝子女王は公爵・徳川慶久に降嫁し、高松宮宣仁親王妃となった宣仁親王妃喜久子らを産んだが40代半ばで結腸癌で他界した。
sen.e: Princess Mieko left the Imperial family and married with Yoshihisa TOKUGAWA, she gave a birth to Kikuko, who became Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Nobuhito's Empress, however she became colon cancer in her mid forty and died.

Princess Mieko left the Imperial family and married Yoshihisa TOKUGAWA, she gave birth to Kikuko, who later became Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Nobuhito's Empress, however she came down with colon cancer in her mid forties and died.

Princess Mieko left the Imperial family and married Prince Yoshihisa TOKUGAWA, she gave birth to Kikuko, who later became Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Nobuhito's Empress, however she came down with colon cancer in her mid forties and died.

sen.j: 威仁親王は生来体が弱く、艦長時代も度々休職して静養するなどしていたが、栽仁王の薨去後はそのショックもあって体調が悪化し、明治42年（1909年）から薨去に至るまで、現在の兵庫県神戸市垂水区にあった有栖川宮家の舞子別邸で家族を東京に残して静養を行った。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Takehito was born weak, he had to take time off for rest while he was working as a Captain, after Prince Tanehito died, his health got worth as he was shocked from the Prince's death, he rested in Arisugawanomiya family's villa in Maiko located in current Tarumi ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture, leaving his family behind in Tokyo.

Imperial Prince Takehito was born weak, he had to take time off for rest while he was a Captain, after Prince Tanehito died, his health got worse as he was shocked by the Prince's death, he rested in Arisugawanomiya family's villa in Maiko located presently in Tarumi ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture, leaving his family behind in Tokyo.

Imperial Prince Takehito was born weak, he had to take time off for rest while he was a Captain, after Prince Tanehito died, his health got worse as he was shocked by the Prince's death, he rested in Arisugawa no Miya family's villa in Maiko located presently in Tarumi Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture from 1909 to his death, leaving his family behind in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: from 1909 to his death補足Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせるward→Ward

sen.j: 大正2年（1913年）7月5日、威仁親王は舞子別邸において52歳で薨去した。
sen.e: He died in the villa in Maiko on July 5th, 1913, when he was fifty two years old.
He died in the villa in Maiko on July 5th, 1913, when he was fifty two years old.
He died in the villa in Maiko on July 5, 1913, when he was fifty two years old.

sen.j: だが諸般の事情により喪は秘され、7月10日に遺体は「御重体」のまま汽車に乗せられ、東京の麹町区三年町2番地（現在の内閣府庁舎の付近）にあった宮邸に搬送された。
sen.e: However his death was kept quiet due to various reasons, his body was carried on the train while he was said to be in the serious condition, and transferred to the Imperial Palace which used to be at 2-banchi, San nen-cho Town, Kojimachi Ward. (near current Cabinet Office)
sen.cmt: 三年町の読み方確認できず
sen.e: However his death was kept quiet due to various reasons, his body was carried on a train while he was said to be in the serious condition, and transferred to the Imperial Palace which used to be located at 2-banchi, San nen-cho Town, Kojimachi Ward. (near the current Cabinet Office)

However his death was kept quiet due to various reasons, on July 10 his body was carried on a train while he was said to be in the serious condition, and transferred to the Imperial Palace which used to be located at 2-banchi, San nen-cho, Kojimachi Ward (near the current Cabinet Office).
sen.cmt: on July 10補足住所表記ピリオドの位置

sen.j: この日初めて喪が発表され、薨去の日付も7月10日とされた。
sen.e: His death was announced for the first time on this day, it was decide the date he died was on July 10th.
His death was announced for the first time on this day, it was decide the date he died was on July 10th.
His death was announced for the first time on this day, it was decide the date he died was on July 10.

sen.j: 超えて17日に斂葬の儀が行われ、豊島ヶ岡御陵に埋葬された。
sen.e: After that the Ceremony of Interment was held on 17th, the body was buried in the Toshima ga Oka Mausoleum.
sen.cmt: 斂葬の儀→the Ceremony of Interment[定訳不明]
sen.e: After that the Ceremony of Interment was held on 17th, the body was buried in the Toshima ga Oka Mausoleum.
After that the Ceremony of Interment was held on 17, the body was buried in the Toshima ga Oka Mausoleum.

sen.j: これにより、男系の後継者がいない有栖川宮家は皇室典範の定めによって断絶が確定したが、威仁親王の教育を受け、身分を越えて親王を慕っていた大正天皇は有栖川宮家の維新以降の功績を特に慮り、第三皇子の宣仁親王にその祭祀を継承させた。
sen.e: After his death, following the Imperial Family Law, it was decided for Arisugawanomiya family to be discontinued as there was no male successor in the family, Emperor Taisho who was taught by Imperial Prince Takehito and was fond of him although there was a difference in social standing, the Emperor considered the achievement of the Arisugawanomiya family especially after the restoration, he let the third Prince, Imperial Prince Nobuhito to succeed to the ritual of the family.

After his death, following the Imperial Family Law, it was decided for the Arisugawanomiya family to be discontinued as there was no male successor in the family, Emperor Taisho who was taught by Imperial Prince Takehito and was fond of him although there was a difference in social standing, the Emperor considered the achievements of the Arisugawanomiya family especially after the restoration, he let the third Prince, Imperial Prince Nobuhito succeed to the ritual of the family.

After his death, following the Imperial Family Law, it was decided for the Arisugawa no Miya family to be discontinued as there was no male successor in the family, Emperor Taisho who was taught by Imperial Prince Takehito and was fond of him although there was a difference in social standing, the Emperor considered the achievements of the Arisugawa no Miya family especially after the restoration, he let the third Prince, Imperial Prince Nobuhito succeed to the ritual of the family.
sen.cmt: Arisugawanomiya→Arisugawa no Miya 他ファイルに合わせる

sen.j: なお、薨去の直後の7月7日に元帥に列せられ、大勲位菊花章頸飾が授与されているが、公式発表では生前に授けられたものとされた。
sen.e: Just after the Prince's death on July 7th, he was appointed as a Marsharl and was conferred the Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, but it was officially decided to be conferred while he was alive.

Just after the Prince's death on July 7th, he was appointed as a Marshal and was conferred the Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, and it was officially decided to be conferred while he was alive.

Just after the Prince's death on July 7, he was appointed as a Marshal and was conferred the Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, and it was officially decided to be conferred while he was alive.

tit.j: 威仁親王ゆかりの場所
tit.e: Related places to Imperial Prince Takehito.

sen.j: 天鏡閣 （福島県猪苗代町に現存する元別邸、庭に銅像が建てられている。)
sen.e: Tenkyo-kaku Residence (This former villa exist in Inawashiro-machi Town, Fukushima prefecture, there is a statue in the garden.)

sen.e: The Arisugawa no Miya Memorial Park (the place where used to a villa locate at Minato ku, Tokyo and there is a statue of his older brother, Imperial Prince Taruhito.)

sen.j: 威仁親王の薨去後、高松宮別邸や民間企業の保養所を経て神奈川県に譲渡された。)
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Takehito died, the place was changed from Takamatsu no Miya villa and a recreation facility, after that it was handed over to Kanagawa Prefecture.)

sen.j: シーサイドホテル舞子ビラ神戸 （威仁親王最期の地、兵庫県神戸市垂水区の別邸跡に建つホテル。）
sen.e: Seaside Hotel Maiko Villa (This was where Imperial Prince Takehito died, a hotel build in the place where the villa use to be, located at Tarumi Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture.)
